_header: In May as that Aurora did upspring
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Merle and the Nichtingaill’ — fifteen eight-line stanzas with alternating refrains, ‘A lusty lyfe in luves seruice bene’ and ‘All luve is lost bot vpone god allone'’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
In may as aurora did vpspringwith cristale ein chaissing the
                    cloudis sabill…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…To think how sang this merle and nichtingaleAll luif is lost
                    bot vpon god allone
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.188-91.

Banna.First Lines:
In may as that aurora did vpspringWith cristall ene chasing þe
                    cluddis sable…
Banna.Last Lines:
…To think how song this merle and nychtingaillAll lufe is lost
                    bot vpone god allone
